evidence.text: Person B: Well, sometimes I'm asleep.
Person A: Well, I see that, once again, the responsibility to corrupt my fellow students falls... to me.

Person A: You've been Galinda-fied.
Person A: You don't need to d o that, you know.
Person B: Doctor Dillamond, I picked some poppies for you--
Person A: They're falli ng asleep! Poppy dust. Come on!

Person A: You think I want to be this way? You think I want to care this much?
Person A: You think I don't know how much easier my life would be if I didn't?!
Person A: So no matter how shallow and self- absorbed you pretend to be--
Person A: No, you're not. Or you wouldn't be so unhappy.
Person B: What did you mean to do, back there? And why was I the only one you didn't do it to?

Person B: About Dillamond. And that Lion Cub. I think about that day a lot.
Person A: So do I.
